skill.name: ena-database
skill.description: Access European Nucleotide Archive via API/FTP. Retrieve DNA/RNA sequences, raw reads (FASTQ), genome assemblies by accession, for genomics and bioinformatics pipelines. Supports multiple formats.
skill.summary: Access European Nucleotide Archive via API/FTP. Retrieve DNA/RNA sequences, raw reads (FASTQ), genom...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No executable code is present and no credential access or exfiltration patterns are found. Network examples target documented ENA endpoints only.

content.value_statement: Finding reliable nucleotide records can be slow and inconsistent. This skill guides precise ENA searches and downloads using official APIs and formats.
actual_capabilities: Search ENA records with Portal API queries and filters
Retrieve XML, FASTA, and EMBL records by accession
Get file download URLs using filereport fields
Query taxonomy lineage and scientific name endpoints
List available fields and result types for searches
limitations: Requires ENA service availability and network access
Subject to ENA rate limits of 50 requests per second
Does not perform local sequence analysis or alignment
Large transfers require external tools like FTP or Aspera

use_cases.title: Pull study data
use_cases.description: Find and download runs or assemblies for a specific study accession.

use_cases.title: Build pipelines
use_cases.description: Automate metadata queries and file URL retrieval for batch processing.

use_cases.title: Check taxonomy
use_cases.description: Verify organism lineage and taxonomy IDs for metadata validation.

prompt_templates.title: Find study samples
prompt_templates.prompt: List the sample accessions for study PRJNA123456 and return them as TSV fields: accession,sample_title.

prompt_templates.title: Download FASTQ URLs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use filereport to fetch fastq_ftp and fastq_md5 for run ERR123456 in JSON format.

prompt_templates.title: Assembly search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search assemblies for tax_tree(562) with contig_n50>=50000 and return accession and assembly_name as JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Taxonomy lineage
prompt_templates.prompt: Get taxonomy details for taxon_id 562 and summarize lineage and rank fields.

output_examples.input: Find assemblies for E. coli with contig N50 over 50k and return key fields.
output: Use offset for pagination after 100 results.

best_practices: Use Portal API for searches and Browser API for direct record retrieval
Handle HTTP 429 with backoff and batch requests
Prefer JSON or TSV when only metadata is required
anti_patterns: Sending uncontrolled high-rate requests without delays
Downloading large files through API instead of FTP or Aspera
Parsing XML with regex instead of a proper XML parser

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is plain text and works in all three platforms.

faq.question: What limits apply to ENA requests?
faq.answer: ENA enforces about 50 requests per second and returns HTTP 429 on overuse.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides API patterns and fields suitable for scripted workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my local data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. The content only references public ENA endpoints and formats.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check status codes, validate parameters, and retry with backoff for 429 or 5xx.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic web search?
faq.answer: It uses official ENA APIs, which are faster and more precise for accession-based queries.
